meanings.definition: To fill or take up (space, time, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The toys were occupying the entire room.
meanings.sent2: The students were occupying their time with homework.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were occupying the bird feeder, much to the birds' dismay.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were occupying her mind like unwelcome guests.
meanings.sent5: The loud music was occupying every corner of the house.

meanings.definition: To reside or live in (a place)
meanings.sent1: The family was occupying the cozy cabin for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The birds were occupying the nest in the tree.
meanings.sent3: The cat was occupying the sunny spot on the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood were occupying her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The old man was occupying the bench in the park, feeding the pigeons.

meanings.sent1: The army was occupying the enemy's territory.
meanings.sent2: The new tenants were occupying the apartment next door.
meanings.sent3: The cat was occupying the best seat in the house, the armchair by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The darkness was occupying the abandoned house, making it seem haunted.
meanings.sent5: The vines were occupying the garden, slowly taking over the flower beds.
